intro: Arachnothryx gracilispica, commonly known as the slender-spined arachnothryx, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to tropical regions of South America. It is a shrub characterized by its small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by small, woody fruits. Its unique morphology, including the slender spines on its stems, makes it easily identifiable. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
